Articles.Content:
Story

We were all in a station when the kraken striked,luckily,we got into the escape pods and found an abandoned base.It has small amounts of water but no food.

Notes

We are in the same base,so we have to teamup to survive

The escape pod was poorly made,so no resources there

Now comment of what you will do to survive

Oxygen survey.

How much do we have, how much energy needed to keep it breathable (temperature/pressure), how many/what type of air scrubbers are there?

Communications survey.

With whom can we talk for how long (time window/energy requirements)?

Food survey.

Who of you looks the tastiest? (not me)
i would enable all solar panels
Map/starfield survey: I have no freaking clue where we are!

I'm going to check the power source of this base for any need of maintenance, and if it's something that can explode/irradate/whatever, I'll triple-check it for stability. If it's going to go critical any time soon, I'm going to eject it.

Scan the whole base for danger. You know how many sci-fi horror plots involved abandoned bases? I mean, people are not going to spend all that money to set up a base (where is this base, by the way?) and abandon it. Something has went *very* wrong there.

Improvise anything we can get to weapons, and go search for clues that help us identify the danger that cause the former inhabitant to evacuate (or killed) in the first place.
I look out the window to figure out which planet, moon or other astronomical body we are on.
This is Stellar Cartography reporting in, we've nearly completed the Night Sky Survey, and will relay the map soon.
I pressed Self-Destruct button

Now why do all the toilets in this darned base have Self-Destruct buttons?

Now, I'll have to find my copy of The Martian, and see what Mark Whatney would do...

I finally finish the maintenance of the reactor, but then it begins to go kablooie due to the Self Destruct button on the toilet being connected to the reactor, and the reactor being the only thing on this base that is still in any way combustible. I curse like a PG sailor while ejecting the darn thing into space. If we're on a planet, I shoot it out of a mass driver.

. o O (note to self: EdusacconBR will be eaten first.)

I disable all selfdestruct mechanisms I can find. Then scowl (mildy, funny it was for a second or two) at EdusacconBR.

Making a list of all (emergency) space suits incl location for regular maintenance, and recalculating remaining powersupply excl. ejected reactor.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-26T20:56:51Z" title="06/26/2015 08:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 26, 2015</time> by heng**
  
typo, fifth

Check for poison in air, water, food. Check air filtering system. Check if there is any movie-like air vent that are suspiciously spacious and very often harbour deadly xeno-organisms. Also keep a psychological record of fellows survivor along with myself to ensure the danger (if presented) is not psychological in nature.

I look for communications equipment and try to get it running again. I'm not particularly successful, which isn't very surprising considering I hardly know anything about communications equipment. I ask the next person who enters this room for help.
EVA outside and see if any parts of the base broke off, try to tether those back on if there are any/

After looking at EdusacconBR angrily for a moment, I go to the botanical area, trying to find a potato, or any other vegetable capable of producing electricity. If it was enough for an AI, then it's going to be enough for a nanosecond of powering something useful.
I begin plotting to eliminate the rest of you as you have all become competitors for the same limited resources.
I send part of myself, as water, to consume all of you by being consumed. Then, I hope to send out a coms link to get me rescue and use as little energy as possible during my stay at the base.

> 
> I begin plotting to eliminate the rest of you as you have all become competitors for the same limited resources.

Dangerous signs...this could mean we are in a zone where the environment messed with human psyche...could be EM waves, could be virus, could be even supernatural space demon. Wait, maybe it is the Kraken itself. Either way, we must start finding ways to get out of here fast!
i found a small solar panel, a xbox one and some games, who wanna play something?

I give up on trying to get the communications equipment working and look for supplies. I encounter **RainDreamer**, who looks somewhat paranoid and nervous, and start a conversation, mentioning that the comm devices seem to be beyond repair.

i planted a coconut, now we got infinite supplies

(the greek called it the tree of life ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

It seems like we are on Bop.The tree will probally just die

I went to look at the reactor to find that theres a small leak that can blow us all up...

Quickly runs to Nathaniel after hearing that he had found a second reactor, and after seeing a leak in it, curses like a PG sailor, and asks the crew over the radio "Should we eject this one right now, or wait some time to get some more power out of it, and eject it when it gets closer to exploding?"

> 
> Food survey.
> 
>  Who of you looks the tastiest? (not me)

I like the way this guy thinks.
